item.title: About me
item.description: I’m an applied microeconomist with a focus on behavioral and experimental economics. In my research I combine theory and experimental evidence to structure and guide analysis. My interests are quite varied: in the past, I have worked on the interaction between concerns for animal welfare and prosocial behavior towards human beings (it’s positive) understanding when customer-driven pricing mechanisms work (it depends…) examining whether context influences decision making in a speed dating experiment (it does).

item.title: Colophon
item.description: This website has been generated using Hugo, a fast static website generator. It uses a template by bootstrapious.com, ported to Hugo by Kishan B. It runs on GitHub Pages, using the excellent blogdown R package by Yihui Xie in the background. The entire code for building this website is available on GitHub. Getting this site up and running is due to a combination of two great tutorials by Robert Myles McDonell and Amber Thomas.

item.title: Get in touch
item.description: If you would like to get in touch, feel free to shoot me an email at mail [at] florentinkraemer [dot] com.
